oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Macedonia Baptist Church: view of church front and side
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church front and side. The gable-front church contains a gable-roofed portico. The main building features brickwork, double doors, and a steeple. The parking lot sits to the side of the building.

Established in 1898, Macedonia Baptist Church resides in Newport, Tennessee. In 1978, the current building on White Oak Avenue was built under the pastorate of Reverend C. J. Mize. At the time of fieldwork, James C. Billings served as pastor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
